column4: I've got a question, did dual-boot Ubuntu over an XP Media Center install, used the Ubuntu partition resize in install and now XP won't boot, the std grub entry doesn't work, GRUB doesn't recognize the filesystem type
I can mount the XP partition and read all the files no problem, so it's still there
pastebin your /boot/grub/menu.lst
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/26777/
sda3 is Ubuntu
you have both media centre and regular XP? xD Why?
I assume that's not your whole list?
what would happen if you changed "rootnoverify" to "root"?
I've done plain root, I've also done a hide statement for each, with no luck
I've done a hide and then set root from the grub> prompt too
and what does it tell you when you try to boot like that, again?
fwiw, I'm not that new to this, and have several other Ubuntu dual boot boxes I've done from the installer with XP Pro and they work
I get 0x7 unknown operating system
ah. Then I don't know. My old computer absolutely refused to let grub boot windows. It totally screwed up. I had to use PartitionMagic's boot loader. But this one is fine with the same settings.
yeah I suspect that the parted corrupted the boot block somehow
won't it work to just ln -s /usr/lib/...whatever.../mplayerplugin-in* ~/.mozilla/plugins ?
dunno, my command will do it for sure
yes it will. Just tested it.
mine is easy too ;-) just have to be used to what it means
you used one!!!!
I took YOUR OWN wildcard, and took it out of a loop! That's it!
inneresting it works on Solaris too heh, just never thought that would work for some reason
Java compiler\vm
